course_description: This course explores the concepts and tools in which traders and investors measure and manage the challenges of trading in the global markets, including market, counterparty credit and operational risks.  Students will experiment with methods to quantify and hedge portfolio risks including calculating Value-at-Risk, analyzing a portfolioÂ¿s sensitivity to key risk factors, scenario analysis and historical stress testing.  Students will learn how CROs use credit risk metrics such as current and potential future exposure to limit exposure to trading counterparties, and how these risks can be mitigated by taking initial and variance margin as negotiated in credit support annex of the ISDA.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the MAF program.
